etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in William Jevons (1835–1882), economist and philosopher of science. From ancient Greek πηδητικός springing, leaping, apparently (although attested earlier) from Hellenistic Greek πηδητής dancer + -ικός

definitions: Of or relating to Brownian motion (pedesis).

notes.text: "pedetic motion" noun also pedetic movement Brownian motion.
